[33mkubectl controls the Kubernetes cluster manager.[0m
[33m[0m
[33m Find more information at: https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/kubectl/overview/[0m
[33m[0m
[33mBasic Commands (Beginner):[0m
[33m  create         Create a resource from a file or from stdin.[0m
[33m  expose         Take a replication controller, service, deployment or pod and expose it as a new Kubernetes Service[0m
[33m  run            Run a particular image on the cluster[0m
[33m  set            Set specific features on objects[0m
[33m[0m
[33mBasic Commands (Intermediate):[0m
[33m  explain        Documentation of resources[0m
[33m  get            Display one or many resources[0m
[33m  edit           Edit a resource on the server[0m
[33m  delete         Delete resources by filenames, stdin, resources and names, or by resources and label selector[0m
[33m[0m
[33mDeploy Commands:[0m
[33m  rollout        Manage the rollout of a resource[0m
[33m  scale          Set a new size for a Deployment, ReplicaSet, Replication Controller, or Job[0m
[33m  autoscale      Auto-scale a Deployment, ReplicaSet, or ReplicationController[0m
[33m[0m
[33mCluster Management Commands:[0m
[33m  certificate    Modify certificate resources.[0m
[33m  cluster-info   Display cluster info[0m
[33m  top            Display Resource (CPU/Memory/Storage) usage.[0m
[33m  cordon         Mark node as unschedulable[0m
[33m  uncordon       Mark node as schedulable[0m
[33m  drain          Drain node in preparation for maintenance[0m
[33m  taint          Update the taints on one or more nodes[0m
[33m[0m
[33mTroubleshooting and Debugging Commands:[0m
[33m  describe       Show details of a specific resource or group of resources[0m
[33m  logs           Print the logs for a container in a pod[0m
[33m  attach         Attach to a running container[0m
[33m  exec           Execute a command in a container[0m
[33m  port-forward   Forward one or more local ports to a pod[0m
[33m  proxy          Run a proxy to the Kubernetes API server[0m
[33m  cp             Copy files and directories to and from containers.[0m
[33m  auth           Inspect authorization[0m
[33m[0m
[33mAdvanced Commands:[0m
[33m  diff           Diff live version against would-be applied version[0m
[33m  apply          Apply a configuration to a resource by filename or stdin[0m
[33m  patch          Update field(s) of a resource using strategic merge patch[0m
[33m  replace        Replace a resource by filename or stdin[0m
[33m  wait           Experimental: Wait for a specific condition on one or many resources.[0m
[33m  convert        Convert config files between different API versions[0m
[33m  kustomize      Build a kustomization target from a directory or a remote url.[0m
[33m[0m
[33mSettings Commands:[0m
[33m  label          Update the labels on a resource[0m
[33m  annotate       Update the annotations on a resource[0m
[33m  completion     Output shell completion code for the specified shell (bash or zsh)[0m
[33m[0m
[33mOther Commands:[0m
[33m  api-resources  Print the supported API resources on the server[0m
[33m  api-versions   Print the supported API versions on the server, in the form of "group/version"[0m
[33m  config         Modify kubeconfig files[0m
[33m  plugin         Provides utilities for interacting with plugins.[0m
[33m  version        Print the client and server version information[0m
[33m[0m
[33mUsage:[0m
[33m  kubectl [flags] [options][0m
[33m[0m
[33mUse "kubectl <command> --help" for more information about a given command.[0m
[33mUse "kubectl options" for a list of global command-line options (applies to all commands).[0m
